sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均可表示"公司"之意。
means: company ： 多指生产或销售产品的公司、商号，也可指经办服务性项目的公司。
corporation ： 多指一个人拥有或多人联办的大公司，也指在其它地区或国家拥有分公司的公司。
firm ： 含义广泛，可指公司、商行或商号。规模可大可小，经营、管理的人员可多可少。

jx.jx_en_mean: used after a person's name to denote those people usually associated with them
jx.jx_cn_mean: [用于人名后表示与之交往的人或与之有来往的人]

jx.jx_en_mean: be in the same situation as someone important or respected
jx.jx_cn_mean: 和…一样重要；像…一样受尊敬

jx.jx_en_mean: with another person or a group of people

lj.lj_ly: he feels at ease in company.

lj.lj_ly: the US dollar went through a bad patch in 1986, in company with the oil market.
lj.lj_ls: 1986年，美元和石油行情一起大跌。

jx.jx_en_mean: accompany or spend time with someone in order to prevent them feeling lonely or bored
jx.jx_cn_mean: 陪伴某人；使某人不感孤独（或无聊）
与…亲密交往；与…形影不离

lj.lj_ly: she began keeping company with a real estate developer.
lj.lj_ls: 她开始与一个房地产开发商亲密交往。

entry.def: A company is a business organization that makes money by selling goods or services.

example.ex: Sheila found some work as a secretary in an insurance company.
example.tran: 希拉在一家保险公司找到一份当秘书的工作。

entry.def: A company is a group of opera singers, dancers, or actors who work together.
A company is a group of soldiers that is usually part of a battalion or regiment, and that is divided into two or more platoons.

example.ex: The division will consist of two tank companies and one infantry company...
example.tran: 这个师的组成部队将包括两个坦克连和一个步兵连。

example.ex: C Company's sentries were just ahead.

entry.def: Company is having another person or other people with you, usually when this is pleasant or stops you feeling lonely.

example.ex: 'I won't stay long.' — 'No, please. I need the company'...
example.tran: “我不会呆很久。”“别这样，求你了。我需要有人陪。”

example.ex: Ross had always enjoyed the company of women...
example.tran: 罗斯总是喜欢有女人陪伴。

entry.def: You can say and company after mentioning a person's name, to refer also to the people who are associated with that person.
entry.tran: (用于某人的名字之后表示)及其同伴，一伙

example.ex: Keegan and company approached the game with understandable caution.
example.tran: 基根一伙人小心谨慎地对待这场比赛，这是可以理解的。

entry.def: If you say that someone is in good company, you mean that they should not be ashamed of a mistake or opinion, because some important or respected people have made the same mistake or have the same opinion.
entry.tran: (不必为错误自责，因为)大人物们也犯过同样的错

example.ex: Mr Koo is in good company. The prime minister made a similar slip a couple of years back.
example.tran: 库先生的错大人物也犯过。几年前首相就有过类似的疏漏。

entry.def: If you have company, you have a visitor or friend with you.

example.ex: He didn't say he had had company.

entry.def: When you are in company, you are with a person or group of people.

example.ex: When they were in company she always seemed to dominate the conversation...
example.tran: 他们在一起的时候，她好像总是操纵着话语权。

example.ex: I feel awkward and shy in company.
example.tran: 跟别人在一起的时候，我觉得很别扭，不好意思。

entry.def: If you feel, believe, or know something in company with someone else, you both feel, believe, or know it.
entry.tran: 和…有同样的想法(或感觉、认识)

example.ex: Saudi Arabia, in company with some other Gulf oil states, is concerned to avoid any repetition of the two oil price shocks of the 1970s.
example.tran: 避免20世纪70年代两次石油价格冲击的情形再次出现，这是沙特阿拉伯和其他一些海湾石油国家一致关心的问题。

entry.def: If you keep someone company, you spend time with them and stop them feeling lonely or bored.

example.ex: Why don't you stay here and keep Emma company?
example.tran: 你为什么不呆在这儿，陪陪埃玛？

entry.def: If you keep company with a person or with a particular kind of person, you spend a lot of time with them.

example.ex: He keeps company with all sorts of lazy characters.
example.tran: 他与形形色色的懒人为伍。

entry.def: If two or more people part company, they go in different directions after going in the same direction together.

example.ex: The three of them parted company at the bus stop.
example.tran: 他们三个在公共汽车站分了手。

entry.def: If you part company with someone, you end your association with them, often because of a disagreement.

example.ex: The tennis star has parted company with his Austrian trainer...
example.tran: 这位网球明星与他的奥地利教练分道扬镳。

example.ex: We have agreed to part company after differences of opinion.

entry.def: If you part company with someone on a particular subject, you disagree with them on it.

example.ex: Where I part company with him, however, is over the link he forges between science and liberalism.
example.tran: 然而，我与他产生分歧的地方是，他把科学与自由主义联系了起来。

entry.def: If you are making a general, unfavourable comment about a particular type of person, and you are with people of that type, you can say 'present company excepted' as a way of making your comment sound more polite.

means.word_mean: 1. an institution created to conduct business;

sentences.sentence: "he only invests in large well-established companies"
"he started the company in his garage"

means.word_mean: 2. organization of performers and associated personnel (especially theatrical);

sentences.sentence: "the traveling company all stayed at the same hotel"

means.word_mean: 3. the state of being with someone;

sentences.sentence: "he enjoyed the society of his friends"

means.word_mean: 4. small military unit; usually two or three platoons
5. a band of people associated temporarily in some activity;

sentences.sentence: "they organized a party to search for food"
"the company of cooks walked into the kitchen"

means.word_mean: 6. a social gathering of guests or companions;

sentences.sentence: "the house was filled with company when I arrived"
"the room was a mess because he hadn't expected company"

means.word_mean: 8. a unit of firefighters including their equipment;
9. crew of a ship including the officers; the whole force or personnel of a ship

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in senses 2 and 3 ): from Old French compainie; related to compaignon (see companion)
